website_summaries.verdict: With its touch screen, quad-core CPU, and modest price tag, the Lenovo C260 Touch is an excellent basic touch PC, and raises our expectations for budget all-in-one desktops.

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this one.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing. I had a Lenovo 12 inch laptop which was brilliant, so expected a lot here. It gets 3 stars because it is good value for money and it works for all the basic PC/Internet stuff. But the processor and the graphics chip are miserable. The Wifi chip has bad drivers and the Wifi keeps stopping. The Lenovo supplied stuff is not good. This PC was supplied with the horrific Lenovo rootkit problem. There is permanently a yellow triangle (Microsoft warning) in the device drivers. The UEFI (the new BIOS replacement) is very non-standard. And there are more niggles. -------- One year on and poor experience : this "All in One" is a turkey. I reduced the stars to 1.
customer_reviews.author: P Finch

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time!
customer_reviews.text: Very dissapointed, as a lot of the other reviews on Amazon and the internet on the Lenovo C260, this PC never really worked from out of the box. Once turned on and the updates were completed, the PC started to freeze and lock up. Only turning the PC off by the mains would get it working again, 5 minutes of it being turned back on it would lock up again. Sometimes it would throw out the odd disc error message or that it couldn't find the operating system! All in all a complete lemon, I wouldn't recommend this PC until someone sorts all of the software/compatibility issues out. I nearly sorted it out with a 4lb club hammer....
customer_reviews.author: Richie

customer_reviews.title: Where's the 0 star?
customer_reviews.text: Do not purchase this product from the Amazon Warehouse. All of them come faulty. I've had to return two now. The first one has no product key, the second ones screen didn't work & had no product key either when I plugged a monitor into it. Pathetic that they fail to check their products before selling.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Excellent reliable bargain
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic Bargain. I bought this 3 years ago for £180 on amazon and it is still going strong. I have updated it to windows 10 and office 2016 and it is a great reliable workhorse which I am very fond of.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Cowley

customer_reviews.title: good but no good !
customer_reviews.text: I had to send two machines back as the soft ware does not work! Lenovo told me on the phone that it must be a batch problem, but did not offer any compensation, Amazon replaced the first one right away but on the second one wanted me to pay for return but, on following a phone call to them, they agreed to return and reunfund for free ;o)..so am now looking for something else! I still need a new computer, more research etc....
customer_reviews.author: paul bartley

customer_reviews.title: I am aware this might have been an error with the secific one we had as all other reviews looked great hence the reason I had ch
customer_reviews.text: Had to return this as the processor speed was so slow, and it kept crashing. I am aware this might have been an error with the secific one we had as all other reviews looked great hence the reason I had chosen it. I have since replaced this with a different model and it works fine. Lenovo is still a good brand in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Amy O

customer_reviews.title: Good value, and perfect for what we need from a PC
customer_reviews.text: Bought as an upgrade (from an old laptop) for a child about to start secondary school - interested in MS Office, browsing, video and the occasional game. Upgraded to Windows 10 within the first hour and all is well. Perfect for what we want from the machine when term starts, and also happy child as Minecraft runs very well too!
customer_reviews.author: Yorkie

customer_reviews.title: In principle they're decent but they run very very slow ...
customer_reviews.text: In principle they're decent but they run very very slow for a windows 8/10 system and one completely broke down within 12 months and had to send back. They returned a brand new one which meant all saved documents on the broken one were lost.
customer_reviews.author: YAYO Familia Ltd

customer_reviews.title: but love it now
customer_reviews.text: Took me a while to get used to it after my old Windows & computer, but love it now. Had to change some of the colour settings to get better on-screen definition. Much faster than my previous computer, and takes up much less room. An excellent buy and great value for money.
customer_reviews.author: Miss N.

customer_reviews.title: There's a sweet spot but beyond that you're on your own
customer_reviews.text: The only downside is when you want the screen to be nearer 90' from the table, the back leg pops shut at a certain point. There's a sweet spot but beyond that you're on your own.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I was a little nervous about purchasing this computer as the reviews seemed quite mixed. We are a homeschool family and so need something reliable. I have to say that I have been really impressed with it. Absolutely no problems with it at all. Nice and compact and just suits all our needs.

I am an older person so I only use my PC for my personal items and browsing the internet. Price is well worth the product.

Had some issues with the USB ports not working following a bios flash, but all fixed after reflashing the same firmware again.

customer_reviews.title: Lenovo C260 all in one desktop
customer_reviews.text: This is my first all-in-one desktop, and I would recommend it as a real value for money buy. I reckon you would be hard-pressed to get better performance from a pc costing twice as much. When I was browsing reviews prior to purchase, I read a couple from so-called "experts", writing for pc magazines, which were unfairly critical, describing the performance as "underwhelming". I'm glad I ignored them. This is a superb machine, as fast as I need. Windows 8 comes pre-installed and, again, doesn't deserve its negative reviews. The whole package is an amazing deal at £279. Don't hesitate - buy it!
customer_reviews.author: I Taylor

product_meta.title: Lenovo C260 19.5-Inch HD All-in-One Desktop PC (Intel Celeron J1800 2.41 GHz, 4 GB RAM, 500 GB HDD, DVD-RW, WLAN, Camera, Integrated Graphics, Windows 8.1) - Black
product_meta.description:
The affordable 19.5" Lenovo C260 is a compact space-saving All-in-One PC with up to dual-core processing capabilities.

BOX CONTAINS
Lenovo Desktop PC
AC Adapter
Lenovo USB Keyboard
Lenovo USB Mouse
User Documentation
feature_bullets: Affordable - budget beating value with an Intel Celeron procesor
Space Saving - intelligent design means the C260 can fit into even tight spaces
AccuType keyboard with numeric keypad and individual rounded keys for comfortable and accurate typing

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars195 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
